Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2010 04:23AM KWolf wrote: I had my needle bx done using mammo, I did not have to lie down with my breast hanging down, I was sat in a large hight adjustable seat and my breast was in the mammo machine between the 2 plastic plates.  The biopsy was then done using the mammo to guide the needle. I have just had a MRI and am waiting for the results, My Onc like to use MRI as she thinks it shows more which makes it easier to catch something quickly..
Posts.Title: Positive Mammo but negative ultra sound? bestauntie bestauntie

Posts.Content: KWolf wrote: I have just come back from my post-op check up with my BS.. well it turns out that my BS has gone on vaccation and it was her PA that I was seeing.. she checked my wound and said it looked good.. then she said the pathology results were not back yet so she could not tell me anything.. I am so upset, I just wanted to know what is going on, I have got to the point where I dont care what it is that they have found I just want to get things moving as all this not knowing is driving me mad.  All I know is that from the first biopsy they found ADH/DCIS but the BS was not sure if there was any invasive cells or not. The PA has said she will call tomorrow if the results come in and if not then on Monday.... I prey to god I dont have to wait until Monday... 1st mamo 03/22 2nd mamo 03/26 1st biopsy 04/06 Surgical wide excisional biopsy 05/07 HERE WE GO AGAIN: - MRI 07/29 Biopsy 08/12 - IBC stage3 Dx 8/20/2010, IBC, 3cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 3, 5/0 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: The Wait Goes On and On !!! KWolf jdfnj2

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2010 10:40PM KWolf wrote: Jen I am having my pre-op done tomorrow, I am a total mess tonight.  I have taken the day off tomorrow I just cant face going into work after the pre-op is done.  I just want May 7th to get here as fast as possible so it can be over, well the surgery that is.. then it will be back to the waiting game for the next results.. I am trying to stay strong but at times I just want to scream...  The ironic thing about all of this is that I gave up smoking on Feb 1st after smoking a pack a day for 35 years... I am happy to say I have not had a smoke since and I dont plan on starting again.. I am going to go and try to read for a while and see if I can get some sleep.. Kath
Posts.Title: Surgery Soon KWolf KWolf

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2010 09:18PM KWolf wrote: Thank you so much for your reply, Can you tell me what the surgery is like? are you in pain? how big is the scar? how long will you have to wait for your results. Sorry for all the ?
Posts.Title: Surgery Soon KWolf KWolf

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2010 08:03AM KWolf wrote: Thanks again for sharing your story with me.  My BS has told me that the ADH is in the center of my left breast and I am a 40 D so I understand where you are coming from.  When I had the first biopsy they left a marker in the place where to took samples from and my BS has said I will have a guide wire put in first and then the surgery.  I found getting numbbed up for the biopsy was painful so I am just hoping that having this wire put in is not as bad as that, I felt like I had been stung by 100 bees. I cant belive just how emotional I am right now, one minute I am ok and thinking I will deal with this with no problems and all is going to be ok and then five minutes later I am crying and thinking the worst.  I have MS as well and I need to use a wheelchair to get about at work and my BS has told me that I will need to be off work for at least 10 days after the surgery to allow myself to heal.  I am so worried about having to take this time off and that on top of everything else makes me feel like its all to much and I just it to all go away. I agree that the waiting is the worst bit of all this, I just want to know what it is and how can it be treated..
Posts.Title: Surgery Soon KWolf KWolf

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2010 01:39PM KWolf wrote: Hi ladies, Well i had mr pre-op evaluation today and everything went well, I had to have a chest x-ray and a EKG both were normal, so at least there is some of me that is normal.. I also had to have bloods done and a urine test. The Doctor that was doing the evaluation asked me to tell him what I was having done and what I had been told by my BS and PCP.  I told him about the biopsy results of ADH and that my BS want me to be seen by a Med Oncologist about further treatment. We talked about the surgery and how I felt about it and how I was dealing with the emotions that come with this situation.  I told him about being emotional and he said he would have been very worried if I was not bothered by all that is going on.  I told him about the support that I have found here and he said that knowledge is my best friend and any help and support I can find to help me deal with all this is a good thing.  So now I have to wait again for the surgery on May 7th...
Posts.Title: Surgery Soon KWolf KWolf

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2010 08:05AM KWolf wrote: jodi, Good Luck today, Hope all goes well. You are in my thoughts..
Posts.Title: Surgery Soon KWolf KWolf

Posts.Content: May 9, 2010 11:08AM KWolf wrote: Update.... I arrived at Brigham & Womens Hospital at 8:30am on Fri morning, after checking in at the day surgery unit I was sent to the Breast Imiging center to have the wire inserted,  They did numb me up before they put the wire in.  It was almost exactly the same as when I had the Biopsy done but it only took 45 minutes to do it.  I was then taken in a wheelchair back to the day surgery unit where I was seen by my BS just to go over what was going to happen. They took much more tissue than I thought they would, they took about a 3inch diameter section so my boob is looking quite odd. I have a 4inch scar running from my nipple back towards my arm pit.  The BS has said that she thinks we have clear margins but we need to wait for the results to come back. I am very sore and I have never been so bruised in all my life, I have to wear a surgical bra day and night for the next 5 days  and I go back to see the BS on the 13th. so I am hoping to get good news then...
Posts.Title: Surgery Soon KWolf KWolf

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2010 10:45PM KWolf wrote: Makraz, I am going to Brigham & Womans/Dana Faber breast center.  I think I might ask the doctor I am seeing tomorrow for my pre-op for something to help me get through this, I just feel so weak when I read some of the posts on here and there are ladies dealing with far more major stuff than me...  I just wish i could sleep.. Kath
Posts.Title: anxious kjm101 jdfnj

Posts.Content: KWolf wrote: Hi I am new to this forum, I has an abnormal mamo in March 2010 and was called back for more pictures to be taken.  After having another 10 pictures done I was told by the radiographer that I needed to have a Ultra Sound test done and they wanted to do it there and then.  By this point I was getting worried, I asked the lady doing the ultra sound what they had found, she said the doctor would talk to me after she had finished. I was taken from the ultra sound to the doctors office where she told me that they has found some calcium deposits and they needed to do a biopsy to make sure it was nothing to worry about.  I was booked to have the biopsy done on  April 8th.  The Biopsy went ok it was uncomfortable being squashed in the mamo machine for the whole time but I just wanted it to be over and everything to be ok. I got a call 2 days later from my PCP to say that the results were back and they did show a cause for concern and she wanted me to come into her office that day.  I drove to her office in a total state of shock.. The results she gave me were: 1. Benign brest parenchyma with microcyst formation and sclerosing adnosis with associated microcalcifications. 2. Focal (multi) atypical ductal hyperplasia with microcalcifications. BI_RADS 4 She said that there is a possiblity that the ADH could be a DCIS and we needed to get a breast surgeon on board. My PCP called a BS that she has know for some time and she faxes over all the images and path report to the BS.  The BS phoned me later that day to say she would like to meet with me in 2 days time so we can go over everything and see where we go from here.  I met with the BS and she explained about the ADH and that it could be DCIS as there is not much difference between them but they must be treated in a different way.  I am scheduled to have an excisional biopsy/lumpectomy done on May 7th, she also talked about seeing a medical oncoligist once we have the results as I may need radiation therapy or other treatment. I am going for my pre-op tests on thursday and I am starting to get worried.  I have read so many posts on here from people who are so strong, I just feel weak and a wreck.. Any guidance on how to cope with all this would be welcome. 1st mamo 03/22 2nd mamo 03/26 1st biopsy 04/06 Surgical wide excisional biopsy 05/07 HERE WE GO AGAIN: - MRI 07/29 Biopsy 08/12 - IBC stage3 Dx 8/20/2010, IBC, 3cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 3, 5/0 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Surgery Soon KWolf KWolf

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2010 10:30PM KWolf wrote: Kim, I am in the same situation as you are I am to have my wire guided excisional biopsy done on May 7th. I have never felt the way I do now.  One minute I am fine and the next I am a weeping mess.  My Family are trying to be suportave but they have no idea how I feel. I have spent hours reading posts here and doing research on the web.  I want to know what options I have if the results are not good and also what needs to be done if all is well. I am so glad I found this site, the ladies here are wonderful.
